business.headline: India's wholesale inflation drops to 13-month low in AprilIndia's wholesale inflation dropped to 0.85% in April, a 13-month low, as prices of food, fuel, and key items cooled.

Traders' body seeks travel ban on Turkey and Azerbaijan for backing PakistanFollowing their backing of Pakistan, major travel companies have already suspended all travel packages to Turkey and Azerbaijan. Travel booking platform EaseMyTrip has advised its customers to avoid visiting these countries unless absolutely necessary.

Explained: Why RBI is reviewing EV wallets after BluSmart collapseThe central bank has initiated informal discussions with EV charging point operators and other app-based service providers to assess potential consumer risks tied to such platforms.

'Don't just look rich': CA shares 7 habits to build lasting wealthThe first step to financial freedom is breaking the paycheck-to-paycheck cycle and having a safety cushion, which should cover you for 3 to 6 months in case of a job loss, medical emergency, or any unforeseen event.

GRSE, Cochin Shipyard, Mazagon Dock shares rise up to 17%: Good time to buy?At 12:17 pm, shares of Cochin Shipyard were trading 10.37% higher at Rs 1,740.80, while GRSE was trading 15.92% higher at 2,220. Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders was also up over 5%.
New ITR-7 Form out: What's different and who must fileNew fields have been added to the ITR-7 form to help eligible entities clearly report housing loan interest claimed under Section 24(b).

Explained: Why Tata Steel shares jumped over 4% todayAt around 10:30 am, shares of the company were trading 4.41% higher at Rs 156.10 on the BSE. The rally was sparked by fresh optimism following disclosures from top company officials about the scale and focus of Tata Steel's expansion plans.

Raymond shares crash 64%: Why is the stock falling after realty demerger?At last count, the stock was trading at Rs 556.45, down 64.36% from its previous close of Rs 1,561.30. The sharp fall coincided with the ex-date of the demerger, when Raymond shares stopped factoring in the value of its real estate business.

Sensex jumps over 500 points today: Why is the stock market rising today?Today's sharp rebound followed Tuesday's volatile session where the Nifty had tumbled over 400 points from its intraday high before closing near day's low. This was largely due to profit booking after Monday's euphoric ceasefire rally.

Tata Motors shares fall after Q4 results. Key reasons to knowAt first glance, the headline numbers seemed disappointing. A 51% year-on-year drop in consolidated net profit to Rs 8,470 crore and flat revenue at Rs 1.19 lakh crore. But despite the sharp dip in profit, Tata Motors outperformed Street expectations.

Raymond stock in spotlight as realty demerger takes effect. Check detailsAs per the approved scheme, Raymond shareholders will receive one equity share of Raymond Realty for every share held in Raymond. The standalone real estate company is expected to be listed during the September quarter of FY26.

Sensex surges over 400 points, Nifty nears 24,800 as inflation coolsAt 9:29 am, the BSE Sensex was up 462.27 points at 81,610.49, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 135.35 points to 24,713.70. Both indices extended gains shortly after the opening bell, signalling bullish momentum.

entertainment.headline: Tom Cruise's Mission Impossible-Final Reckoning eyes record advance booking in India'Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning' is set to break its previous advance booking record in India. The Tom Cruise film is already selling tickets like hotcakes at the box office.

Criminal Justice trailer: Pankaj Tripathi's case has three sides of truth. WatchThe trailer for 'Criminal Justice - A Family Matter' has been released. The trailer gives a glimpse into the high-stakes legal battle in the upcoming season. Featuring Pankaj Tripathi, the fourth season of the series will stream on JioHotstar starting May 29.

Preity Zinta warns of 'Kali Avatar' if no-photo rule for her twins is brokenActor Preity Zinta talked about wanting privacy for her twins, Jai and Gia, in a recent Ask Me Anything session on X, and highlighted the importance of setting boundaries with the paparazzi.

Exclusive: Actor Angela Bassett on playing President in MI, Tom Cruise, and IndiaAngela Bassett stars as the American President in 'Mission Impossible: The Final Reckoning.' Her role highlights women empowerment and celebrates Indian fashion influence.

Vijay Deverakonda's Kingdom release date postponed amid India-Pak tensionsVijay Deverakonda's action drama 'Kingdom', directed by Gautham Tinnanuri, has been officially postponed. The film, initially planned for a summer release on May 30, will now arrive in cinemas on July 4.

Actor Ram Charan meets ex-boxing champion Julius Francis at London fan meetActor Ram Charan honoured former British boxing champion Julius Francis, who was a bouncer at his fan event in London. He requested the 'RRR' actor to place a boxing belt on his shoulder.

Anushka Sharma gets emotional during Premanand Maharaj's ashram visit with ViratAnushka Sharma recently got emotional during her visit to Premanand Maharaj's ashram with Virat Kohli. A video of the actor holding back her tears has gone viral.

Rupali Ganguly urges Indians to cancel Turkey trips amid India's Operation Sindoor'Anupamaa' actor Rupali Ganguly asked her followers to cancel their trips to Turkey after the country backed Pakistan against India during Operation Sindoor last week.

Robert De Niro and his 35-year-younger girlfriend walk Cannes red carpet. Pics81-year-old Hollywood actor Robert De Niro walked the Cannes 2025 red carpet with girlfriend Tiffany Chen, a martial arts professional. This is one of their rarest public appearances.

Spanish singer Enrique Iglesias to perform in Mumbai this October: ReportEnrique Iglesias will reportedly perform in Mumbai this October. The singer, popular for tracks like 'Bailamos' and 'Heart Attack', has earlier performed in India in 2004 and 2012.

Aamir Khan and Rajkumar Hirani to reunite after 5 years: ReportAamir Khan and Rajkumar Hirani are set to reunite after five years for an upcoming project. Reportedly, the production is expected to begin after 'Sitare Zameen Par' release.

Salma Hayek is ageless and iconic at 58 on Sports Illustrated Swimsuit cover. WatchAt 58, Salma Hayek makes a powerful debut on the 'Sports Illustrated Swimsuit' cover, challenging age stereotypes with grace and confidence.

Vivek Agnihotri says directors don't 'have guts' to slam actors like Ranbir KapoorFilmmaker Vivek Agnihotri recently said in an interview that Bollywood directors do not have the courage to criticise stars for their performances, while they do the same behind closed doors. He was speaking in the context of the criticism of 'Animal' director Sandeep Reddy Vanga.

Spider-Noir: Nicolas Cage looks dark as Spider-Man in 1st look, teaser leakedActor Nicolas Cage is set returning as Spider-Man in the upcoming series 'Spider-Man Noir'. The makers unveiled his first look from the live-action drama.

BJP leader sues Tamil actor Santhanam for Rs 100 crore over devotional song useTamil actor Santhanam's upcoming film, 'DD Next Level', is currently embroiled in controversy over the use of devotional song. Janasena and BJP members have condemned the use and called for removal of the song from the film.

Robert Downey Jr flexes his muscles in BTS pics from Doomsday setsRobert Downey Jr is busy filming his upcoming movie Avengers: Doomsday. On Tuesday, the actor posted a BTS picture from the set, flexing his biceps, drawing attention from fans.

Anurag Kashyap hits back at Vivek Agnihotri, calls him 'jhoota aadmi'Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri recently accused Anurag Kashyap of alcoholism and shirking writing duties during their collaboration on the film Goal. Anurag Kashyap has strongly denied these allegations, calling Vivek a liar and clarifying he was never on set.

Samay Raina's funny reaction to paps' question on comeback after Latent rowComedian Samay Raina made his first public appearance on Tuesday following the announcement of his much-anticipated comeback tour. However, he remained tight-lipped when asked about the return of his show India's Got Latent.

Actor Nimrat says Sofiya Qureshi-Vyomika Singh's Op Sindoor briefing sends strong messageNimrat Kaur praised women officers Colonel Sofiya Qureshi and Wing Commander Vyomika Singh in Operation Sindoor, highlighting India's secularism and women empowerment.

general news.headline: Turkey helped Pak attack India, sent 350+ drones, military operativesTwo Turkish military operatives were killed as part of Operation Sindoor, which reveals that Turkey not only helped Pakistan in its war against India with over 350 drones, but also with operators, sources told India Today TV.

Pak returns BSF jawan to India 20 days after he accidentally crossed borderBSF constable Purnam Kumar Shaw of the 182nd Battalion was detained by Pakistan Rangers on April 23 after he inadvertently crossed the International Border near Ferozepur, Punjab.

Op Sindoor: India clear winner in air battle against Pak, says aviation expertMilitary historian and aviation analyst Tom Cooper, while talking to India Today, said that India was a clear winner in the air battle against Pakistan.

Creative naming can't alter reality: India rejects China's Arunachal renamingIn a strongly worded statement, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) firmly rejected China's latest attempt to rename several locations in Arunachal Pradesh.
Are Indian exports to Turkey powering its drones?Pakistan attacked India with around 400 Turkish drones in four days. Here's a look at how India's exports are helping Turkey in making these drones.

INS Vikrant-led 36-ship armada was in position to hit Karachi: SourcesFollowing the recent terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam in which 26 people were killed, India launched a tri-pronged pressure strategy on Pakistan. The Navy was placed on high alert, prompting Pakistan to issue NAVAREA warnings amid fears of a possible naval strike.

Jai Bhim: Chief Justice BR Gavai greets lawyers after taking oathJustice Bhushan Ramkrishna Gavai was on Wednesday sworn in as the 52nd Chief Justice of India (CJI) today, becoming the first Buddhist and only the second judge from the Scheduled Castes to ascend to the nation's highest judicial office.

US official shuts down Pak reporter who accused PM Modi of blocking peace dealWhen the Pakistani reporter asked whether the US was disappointed that PM Modi did not welcome the 'peace deal,' US Department of State official Thomas Pigott said that the focus was on the ceasefire. 'Our focus is the ceasefire and encouraging direct communication,' said the US official.

Gavai to be CJI for 6 months, first woman CJI might serve just 36 daysJustice BR Gavai took oath as the 52nd Chief Justice of India on Wednesday, and will serve as the CJI for six months. If you think this is a short tenure, consider that the first possible woman CJI will serve for just 36 days. Yet, her tenure will not be the shortest as CJI.

Live: PM holds key meet with Rajnath Singh, Amit Shah after Cabinet security briefingIndia-Pakistan Ceasefire Live: The Indian armed forces launched Operation Sindoor on May 7 to avenge the Pahalgam attack where 26 people - mostly tourists – were killed. Subsequently, the two countries were involved in military actions against each other. Defence Minister Rajnath Singh told an all-party meeting on May 8 that at least 100 hardcore terrorists and their associates were killed in Indian strikes on terror sites in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied-Kashmir (PoK) under the ongoing Operation Sindoor. The two neighbouring countries reached an understanding for ceasefire on May 10. Follow indiatoday.in for more updates.

Indian-American student dies after falling from Bahamas hotel balconyAn Indian-American student died after falling from a hotel balcony in the Bahamas. Gaurav Jaisingh was on a class trip to the Bahamas and fell to death just six days before his graduation. Gaurav was set to start his career as a consultant in New York City.

China's Global Times, Xinhua blocked in India for spreading Pak propagandaIndia on Wednesday banned Chinese state-run handles of Xinhua News Agency and Global Times on microblogging site X over the spreading of Pakistani propaganda and unverified information amid simmering tensions between Delhi and Islamabad.

Virat Kohli's reply to Premanand Maharaj's 'Prasann Ho' question goes viralA day after announcing his Test retirement, Virat Kohli visited Shri Hit Radha Keli Kunj Ashram in Vrindavan with Anushka Sharma to seek blessings. A video of their conversation with Premanand Maharaj has since gone viral.

Would send suicide bombers to Kolkata: Bangladeshi cleric spews anti-Hindu hateA Bangladeshi Islamic cleric, Maulana Abdul Quddus Faruqi, has called for suicide attacks on Kolkata, endorsing a Taliban-style tactic. In the video that has been watched over 1.3 lakh times, Faruqi declared that if the Bangladesh army permitted it, he would plan the attack. He used hate-filled rhetoric against Hindus and India.

Lashkar, terror allies glorify Pak military op, threaten India at Karachi rallyRadical clerics and leaders from banned and controversial groups assembled under the umbrella of the Difa-e-Watan Council (DWC) -- an alliance known for hosting extremist ideologues -- to heap praise on the military's role in the aftermath of Operation Sindoor.
Aditya-L1 captures eruption that could circle Earth in 30 secondsThe SUIT instrument recorded the flare as it erupted from the Sun's surface, launching a glowing plasma blob.

Cannes 2025: Urvashi Rautela trolled over bold parrot clutch, colourful outfitAnother year, another bold look from Bollywood actor Urvashi Rautela. She walked the red carpet at the 78th Cannes Film Festival in a colourful ensemble, a tiara and a crystal parrot-shaped clutch, sparking buzz online.

Watch India Today special: Operation Sindoor reconstructed using AIIndia Today TV's special report on Operation Sindoor, using AI, reconstructs the daring, covert 100-hour Indian military mission that eliminated over 100 terrorists across nine cross-border camps with precision airstrikes, sending a powerful message of deterrence.

India ramps up trade pact efforts as Trump signals another major deal in worksIndia's recent proposal to the World Trade Organisation to slap retaliatory tariffs on the US -- in response to its import duties on Indian steel and aluminium -- will also feature in the upcoming trade talks during deliberations on the bilateral trade agreement.

Anil Kumble names ideal contender for Virat Kohli's no 4 spot in Test squadLegendary India spinner and former head coach Anil Kumble has given his ideal replacement for Virat Kohli's number four spot in the Indian Test team following the retirement of the star batter.

Can an Open Phone Policy help your relationship or end it?With our phones holding everything, it's no surprise that "open phone policies" are seen as the new relationship test. But is sharing passwords a sign of love—or the start of its slow unravelling?

Ameriki papa ne war...: Congress jabs Centre as Trump claims ceasefire creditUS President Donald Trump claimed credit for facilitating a ceasefire between India and Pakistan during a public event in Saudi Arabia. Reacting to Trump's remarks, senior Congress leader Jairam Ramesh took to X to criticise the Prime Minister Narendra Modi government's silence.

Husband's affair isn't abetment of suicide unless wife was tormented: CourtThe Delhi High Court said an extramarital relationship was not a ground to implicate the husband for dowry death in the absence of a nexus between the alleged relationship and dowry demand.

Days after murder of Bajrang Dal member, Karnataka to set up anti-communal forceKarnataka plans to form an anti-communal force within the police, targeting violence in coastal areas. It will also address moral policing. The move follows the recent murder of ex-Bajrang Dal member Suhas Shetty.

Tom Cruise's Mission Impossible-Final Reckoning eyes record advance booking in India'Mission: Impossible - The Final Reckoning' is set to break its previous advance booking record in India. The Tom Cruise film is already selling tickets like hotcakes at the box office.

Javed-Shabana, Sonam Kapoor, and other celebs at Nirmal Kapoor's 13th day ceremonyNirmal Kapoor, mother of actors Anil Kapoor, Boney Kapoor, and Sanjay Kapoor, died in Mumbai on Friday at the age of 90. Today marks the 13th-day ceremony held in her memory, with several Bollywood celebrities in attendance to pay their respects.

Preity Zinta warns of 'Kali Avatar' if no-photo rule for her twins is brokenActor Preity Zinta talked about wanting privacy for her twins, Jai and Gia, in a recent Ask Me Anything session on X, and highlighted the importance of setting boundaries with the paparazzi.

Exclusive: Actor Angela Bassett on playing President in MI, Tom Cruise, and IndiaAngela Bassett stars as the American President in 'Mission Impossible: The Final Reckoning.' Her role highlights women empowerment and celebrates Indian fashion influence.

sports.headline: Pahalgam fallout: Pakistan doubtful for Asia Cup 2025 hockey in BiharThe Asia Cup will be staged in Rajgir, Bihar from August 27 to September 7. Hosts India, Pakistan, Japan, Korea, China, Malaysia, Oman and Chinese Taipei are scheduled to participate in the 12th edition of the tournament.

India have big shoes to fill without Rohit, Kohli: James AndersonFormer England pacer James Anderson said that India have talent emerging from the IPL, but reckoned that they have big boots to fill after Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli's Test retirement.

Inside the battle for pickleball: Arvind Ramesh Prabhoo calls for national recognitionIn an exclusive conversation with Indiatoday.in, AIPA President Arvind Ramesh Prabhoo explained why the association strongly opposes the Sports Ministry's decision to grant national federation status to the newly-formed Indian Pickleball Association (IPA), and outlined AIPA's long-standing contributions to the development of the sport in India.

Great players should play till 50: Yograj Singh reacts to Rohit, Kohli's retirementsFormer India all-rounder Yograj Singh has reacted to the retirements of star Indian batting duo of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli saying that great players should continue playing till the age of 50.

Virat Kohli trained like an Olympic athlete: Former India coachShanker Basu praised Virat Kohli for setting the benchmark for other players with his strong work and training discipline. Earlier, Kohli retired from Test cricket before India's tour of England.

WTC Final-bound South Africa players likely to miss playoffsSouth African cricketers, who are a part of the World Test Championship Final against Australia, are most likely to miss the playoffs in the Indian Premier League 2025.

Anil Kumble names ideal contender for Virat Kohli's no 4 spot in Test squadLegendary India spinner and former head coach Anil Kumble has given his ideal replacement for Virat Kohli's number four spot in the Indian Test team following the retirement of the star batter.

WPL history maker ruled out of West Indies' tour of EnglandWest Indies all-rounder Chinelle Henry missed out on the tour of England after he failed to recover from a leg injury. The visitors called up Realeanna Grimmond and Jahzara Claxton.

No dancing girls, no DJ: Gavaskar urges BCCI to hold remainder of IPL 2025 quietlyLegendary India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar has urged the BCCI to host the remainder of the Indian Premier League 2025 in a quiet manner to respect the sentiments of the families, who've lost their loved ones in the recent attacks by Pakistan.

Jannik Sinner equals historic feat after pre-quarters winItalian Open 2025: Jannik Sinner made his way through to the quarters in Rome after beating Argentina's Francisco Cerundolo 7-6 (7-2), 6-3 on Tuesday at Centre Court.

Maradona's daughter testifies against football star's doctor for negligenceGianinna Maradona, Diego Maradona's daughter, told the court that her father's health had significantly deteriorated a month before his death, and that she had raised her concerns with Dr. Luque multiple times.

Anil Kumble names ideal contender for Virat Kohli's no 4 spot in Test squadLegendary India spinner and former head coach Anil Kumble has given his ideal replacement for Virat Kohli's number four spot in the Indian Test team following the retirement of the star batter.

WPL history maker ruled out of West Indies' tour of EnglandWest Indies all-rounder Chinelle Henry missed out on the tour of England after he failed to recover from a leg injury. The visitors called up Realeanna Grimmond and Jahzara Claxton.

No dancing girls, no DJ: Gavaskar urges BCCI to hold remainder of IPL 2025 quietlyLegendary India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar has urged the BCCI to host the remainder of the Indian Premier League 2025 in a quiet manner to respect the sentiments of the families, who've lost their loved ones in the recent attacks by Pakistan.

Jannik Sinner equals historic feat after pre-quarters winItalian Open 2025: Jannik Sinner made his way through to the quarters in Rome after beating Argentina's Francisco Cerundolo 7-6 (7-2), 6-3 on Tuesday at Centre Court.

Maradona's daughter testifies against football star's doctor for negligenceGianinna Maradona, Diego Maradona's daughter, told the court that her father's health had significantly deteriorated a month before his death, and that she had raised her concerns with Dr. Luque multiple times.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
